comment: It's unfortunate this class is required for all business students, as it really does feel like it should ONLY be for Accounting and Econ students. So since you have to take it, take it with Dr. Zhang. She is extremely kind, tests are not very hard, and homework are just graded to completion.
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy

comment: She is the best choice for this class. This class is HARD but she made it so much easier. This class reminded me Excel is awesome. Take this as an 8-week if you wanna get it out the way! Midterm and final (both not proctored nor on lockdown),and weekly HW assignments graded on completion
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: She is the best choice for this class. This class is HARD, but she made it so much easier. She taught us great ways to use Excel. She does not use lockdown because a lot of the tests use Excel. She provided extra credit, was available outside of class, and answered any questions I had. Best professor for economics!
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: She made one of the most challenging econ classes easier than expected. She cares and wants you to take make a good grade. She also doesn't use lockdown. She gave extra credit at the end, which was a pleasant surprise.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Caring--Lecture heavy

comment: This was the toughest class I've taken in college.  I knew that going in, but it was very tough.  I managed an A but barely.  Do the HW everyweek, the couple participation requirements.  Finals were tough.  Assigned reading, but I mostly used her PP each week because reading about math doesn't teach me anything.  She has a thick accent. NO LOCKDOWN
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Zhang is a solid choice for Econ3300 online. Weekly homeowork, 2 exams, and a Final. She allows you to use all resources neccessary on all itmes though. However, this is still a tough class. At times langauge can be a barrier, but at the end of the day using your resources will pull you through to a good grade!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Prof. Zhang is a really nice professor and will respond to you quickly with helpful information. The issue I have is that the lecture material doesn't always match a lot of the test questions, leaving you stymied during a timed test to figure it out on your own. This material is hard enough as it is, so please make the tests easier!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: Professor Zhang is a caring and sweet professor. Her class had no group projects, but 3 exams and weekly HW that wasn't too hard but came straight from textbook. She also grades participation, tests were kinda hard but if you study and do HW you will be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: She's really sweet. Always helpful during office hours during the pandemic. Held extra hours. Homework due every week and 2 exam + Final. Final can replace lowest test grade. No quizzes, just homework and exams. Overall, it is a hard stats course, but she tries to be very helpful. Always responds to emails and explains things very thoroughly! Take!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: This class is really hard, but she really does do the best she can to make it as painless as possible. She is incredibly sweet and willing to help. I've had her twice now, and have truly enjoyed being in her class. Even online, you can tell that she has such a positive attitude and a true love for what she teaches!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Caring--Tough grader

comment: She is damn good
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Zhang is the best when it comes to explain App Optimization Statistic. You gotta take her for a better understanding of the subject. In addition , 10 homeworks , lowest one will be dropped . 3 exams , final replaces the lowest one. She is very knowledgeable and fast . Helpful and nice. Attendance is not required but you gotta go .
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I took two math based courses last semester and had a tutor for both. I got a 94 in my Applied Calc class and a 77 in this class. This woman teaches statistics the most outdated and irrelevant way. I am passionate about data analysis but this professor makes it convoluted and overly complicated.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Class in process, she is not helpful, does not answer questions, and when she does choose to respond she is very confusing on her responses. It is her way or the highway. I am very disappointed and struggling with a big lack of concern from the prof.

Professor Zhang makes App. Stats and Optimization Models easy to understand. The homework is challenging, but if you understand it, then the tests will be easier. She also posts feedback and correct answers to study. She is very responsive and answers questions quickly. She's been a great professor that makes this subject so much easier.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. Zhang made statistics easier to understand. Lots of homework, but it is necessary to understand the material, so work hard on homework and tests will be easier. Posts correct homework answers after homework is graded. Study those and you will do well. Grading is clear, but work hard all semester as homework is graded by accuracy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. Zhang's class is set up for you pass. Everyone at Coles knows that App Stat is difficult, majority of your class grade is from homework. Lectures are simple and straight forward, test questions come straight from the homework. Go to class, do your homework and you will pass with a B minimum.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: This class is going to be hard no matter what professor you take but she is a great professor. Tests are not easy and there is a lot of homework to make up for low test grades. Cumulative final replacing lowest test grade.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Zhang is a great professor, she made this Stats class more understandable and it is not an easy course. She gives a breakdown of the course and homework counts for almost have of the class, just do it cause she usually just grades for effort. Classes are not mandatory but if you miss class you won't be prepared for the exams.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Econ 3300 is a hard class. Period. 40% of our overall grade came from HW, so if you at least do the HW & study for the tests, you'll be fine. She is a VERY lenient grader & wants everyone to succeed. She understands not everyone in the class is going to be a statistician. Also, show respect by going to class. It will pay off. Recommend!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Take her! She's friendly and willing to help! Grades: homework 40%, two tests 40% & final 20%. Final replaces lowest test score. Weekly homework (sometimes we didn't have any), and it was only like 3 or 4 problems, so not bad at all. The content itself is not easy, but she allows a 1page front&bac cheat sheet on tests & all of her lectures online.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great professor! She actually teaches, so you don't have to spend hours outside the classroom learning concepts by yourself. Material could be hard if math and analysis are not your thing, but she explains everything step-by-step. Also, no surprises during test day. I currently have a high A. Take her!
rating_tags: Respected--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: She is a tough teacher, but ECON 3300 is an extremely tough class. You will learn a lot from having her as a professor, but you will work for your grades. She is a very lenient grader, but the material is difficult. The breakdown of points for the class is 35% homework, 20% for Test 1, 20% for Test 2, and 25% for the Final Exam.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: She teaches to the power points which are not necessarily difficult. I suggest going to the class to learn the materials. She wants you to pass and has a heavy curve on all of the exams with the final replacing your lowest test score.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT
